Alright, let me start with this, some of the roles are annoying to learn but some are literally the easiest thing. Putting that aside, I find this game very easy since I had people to help me.

I love this so much, the game is already great on its own, with interesting mechanics and people, and is even better when you find the server that you enjoy the most!
To anyone looking to play it for the first time: It'll take a while to learn how to play this game, but there are tutorials to help, and probably the most beginner friendly community of a game I've ever seen

The gift that keeps on giving. A great adaptation and unique from its predecessor, and its community is generally inclusive and welcoming. If you are thinking of playing I recommend the server Wizard's Den as it is the "vanilla" experience, but even regardless you are bound to have a good time.

[h1] it's rlly good if you miss all the lgbt+ supportive stuff [/h1]

For people that will say I am hurt bcs some lgbt supportive stuff - lgbt is not normal, or a natural thing, gays and lesbians? sure, but not trans furry and shit like that. Game companies from games like War Thunder, KCD II, Terraria and idfk what else dont put their personal opinions in their games, i cant imagine how much would lgbt community cry if terraria became all "anti-lgbt" like game and had load screen tips with texts like "being trans is just mental illness". So yeah, I dont like this part of the game. And yeah, you can cry about me not liking it being my problem.

This being the only popular game on steam (that i am aware of, not counting vr chat) that is overly lgbt+ pro supportive, and at the same time not knowing any game that is anti lgbt+ (popular or not), shows who is the "special" one, and who needs "attention"... I get that at least part of the team is from lgbt community, but shiiit, did you know that you could keep it to yourself?

I wouldnt have to spend time writing this shit, if you wouldnt have trauma from childhood, bcs i cant imagine family liking a child that is actively wearing furry suit ðŸ˜­ There goes my personal opinion, u dont like mine? Well deal with it, bcs u put your personal opinions in a open world multiplayer game, nobody can really hate me on this, or u can, but it wont have any value unless u would remove it from the game, which u wont xd

Space Station 14 is... a complicated thing to explain. So was Space Station 13.

Basically, it's a top-down 2d tile-based multiplayer action RP game about spessmen on a station. Numbered above a dozen, evidently.

It was created by Exadv1 over 20 years ago on the BYOND 2D sandbox engine, which was a real piece of work. He started it as an atmospherics simulator. He stopped updating this gamemode and seemingly disappeared, when some folks from Something Awful decompiled the codebase and forked it. And then it got forked again. And again. And again. New features were added. Some were deprecated. The forks are still around out there somewhere, but BYOND still lurks in the shadows. 

So some folks decided to make this port to a BYOND-free sector. This is one of several remake projects ongoing.

The game revolves around several subjective definitions of roleplaying in a multiplayer class RP server. One involves bananas. One involves robusting. One involves being a secret agent guy. One may even involve a stamp. You'll figure out the rules as you go.

If you like a neat game about breaky, flaky systems to tinker with, this is a good one. If you like games with emergent RP gameplay amplified by breaky, flaky systems, you're in for a treat. And if you like to run around as a clown or mime, you are a sick bastard, but would probably find an opportunity. 

A great introduction to this game and its community and history would be through the illustrious Quartermaster, Randolph P. Checkers. No further detail shall be given, I've said enough already.

Remember: your ration chits will only last while supplies last, or until Nanotrasen expires them, or until the AI acts up and starts the machines off firing Hershey's bars at customers, whichever comes first.

Welcome aboard the station. Nanotrasen expects great things from you, and you are down on your metrics this quarter, you little jerk.
Incredible roleplaying game, nice content, great servers like RonStation and Starlight.

A very intimidating game. Your best time with it is bound to be when you're still learning - knowing absolutely every corner of the game will happen at some point, but ruins the magic somewhat. 

Savor the time you have where you're competent but still learning.
SS14 is a awesome game for fanasty, roleplaying, and imagining things! <3 ss14
This is a very atmospheric and well-styled game.
glorified shitpost and roleplay. fun shit to make your own stories while joinin other story of your day in a station in SPACEEEEEE.
Alright, let me start with this, some of the roles are annoying to learn but some are literally the easiest thing. Putting that aside, I find this game very easy since I had people to help me.

I love this so much, the game is already great on its own, with interesting mechanics and people, and is even better when you find the server that you enjoy the most!
To anyone looking to play it for the first time: It'll take a while to learn how to play this game, but there are tutorials to help, and probably the most beginner friendly community of a game I've ever seen

The gift that keeps on giving. A great adaptation and unique from its predecessor, and its community is generally inclusive and welcoming. If you are thinking of playing I recommend the server Wizard's Den as it is the "vanilla" experience, but even regardless you are bound to have a good time.

True unbridled roleplay fun. Can be hard to figure out your character - but you aren't under pressure to be unique or exciting. Extremely deep AND broad, despite being in alpha (meaning, still missing core features). The kind of game that uniquely fills its niche (alongside its predecessor).
Literally the best roleplay game I've ever played. So many mechanics, interaction, and a decent community as well.

i played as a reptilian musician. sat on the bar all shift, playing random songs, talking to the bartender, the captain, and kept ordering moonshine. eventually, a doctor came by checked on me, screamed at me because i was at 93% poison (this is directly after i asked for another glass). then i fell asleep after, thus, Sleeps-On-Bars was born
The game is really fun just don't play wizard den as the admins are nazi's and will perma ban you if you break a rule (first offence btw)

I dont need to use words to be honest. Difficult learning curve but when you get it, you won't go back. Its so good.
And it does not need to be out of beta, it is perfect :3

kill shit and replace organs

10/10

This game is incredible; it has to be one of my absolute favorites. I cannot thoroughly explain why, but I know you could find a variety of answers that reflect the extensive range of content SS14 can offer. It's easy to find your own fun each shift when interacting with the universe and all the characters you'll meet! And the community has been relatively great-- better than most I've seen. :)

As for my reservations, there is a very sharp learning curve due to the complexity of this game, which you'll need help from experienced players to surmount. There's also that One really helpful guy on Youtube, Liltenhead. If you need help, make sure to ask your peers or a mentor!

The gameplay loop can also be genuinely addicting if you don't have your executive functioning skills on lock. This has been a genuine issue for many players, including myself. Shifts last from ~30 minutes up to [i]several hours[/i]. You are allowed to leave early, though many players don't. Make sure to log off when you need to. The people I've played with have been very considerate about this!

- A (mostly) STARLIGHT Player

While I've never played Space Station 13 (a much older game with a few decades of forks and development), which this game is based on, I think Space Station 14 is exceptionally fun and rewarding and challenging.

That is, once you get the hang of it. There's definitely a learning curve, but between picking low stakes roles like janitor, and watching youtube tutorials by liltenhead, it's not so bad. The real appeal of the game is that you're playing with dozens of other people, most of whom you're allied with, so there's a real sense of accomplishment every time you help out another player. Even if it's just picking up a synthesizer and helping the musician play with a more fully formed band, but it can go as far as being a doctor and healing folks after injuries, backing up your salvage teammates while exploring off-station planets for resources and artifacts, or even being a bunch of bad guys working together to take down the command staff.

It's also open source, so there are a few different forks that change the gameplay experience. Some add new species, some add new mechanics, some just plain offer much higher player count per server.

There's so much more to say about this game, and it's only getting better as development continues on.

It's also a delightfully queer friendly game, like there's literally vending machines with a whole bunch of different pride pins to wear if anyone chooses to do so (like me).
This game is fundamentally great, and it is free!

Space Station 14, technically the successor of Space Station 13, is if DND was on Space Crack,

This game can have that same level of variety that DND does, with the most obscene things you have ever seen. To the most mild or awkward moments. 

On one hand, you might have two different cults warring with each other while the Janitor keeps trying to clean up the blood and dead bodies left behind. On the otherhand, you can witness the Chef getting butchered by a Monkey with a Kitchen Knife.

[h1] One of the Best Role-Playing Games [/h1]
Itâ€™s a hard game to get into, but once you are in, [b]you are in![/b] Thereâ€™s a server for whatever youâ€™re interested in. But the best part of this game is the people. SO, SO, SO many people can come together in this silly game and have fun. Sure, there may be some conflict within the community, but in the end, itâ€™s all for the wellbeing of the game.

I love how I can join a match at ANY time and there are always passionate people playing alongside me. This game has its flaws, but the role-playing pushes past them. Iâ€™ve had more gaming highlights playing this than I ever did in any other game.

So if youâ€™re not sure whether you want to play or not, search YouTube for some gameplay! Just know not every round will look like that :)

This game takes "I Pledge Allegiance To The Grind." to a WHOLE 'nother level

Still fun asl tho

Join your first game, wander around marveling at all the characters running about doing their business. Enter in maints and get lost in the dark. Walk into a room with no atmosphere and nearly die because you haven't learned to equip a gasmask/oxygen tank yet. Get dragged to medical by the paramedic and get some new tires and a fluid change at Medical. Back on your feet. Notice people are talking about "Evac" and running off. Why are you gasping? You hear an explosion and people screaming. Run away! Gun fire, hide! Meet a nice man in blood red combat armor that immediately tries to gun you down. Run some more, hide in maints again. Its dark and you're bleeding, but you see something with glowing blue lines. A space bear? Maybe its friendly. Oh no, its not. At all. Finally die for good, become a ghost and see how horribly broken the station is. Realize that this game is pure chaos and that you love it. Get addicted.
It's good, don't play it, it's hard enough joining my favorite servers.

negative.review:
servers always full or need signup, spent 40 minutes just looking for places that i could actually play, too many attrition points just to open a game and not know what to do, and on the rare times you do get to play then gameplay is yet another hurdle to understand
only servers i was actually allowed in were dead ones

if you have the privilege of playing it, probably awesome
otherwise, you need experience for this entry level job

(13 hours because for 11 of those i simply forgot it open)
Has some plus sides but 13 is way ahead in everything. Not much improvement.
If you want a worse version of Space Station 13, - then this game is for you!
somehow the various servers on here have communities so much worse than ss13's that its not even funny. dont reccomend
it's unappealable brimstone
ss13 but bad

Fundamentally it would be a fun roleplaying game. In reality due to the complex nature to do even the most simple tasks you need a some time commitment. So new or somewhat new players are few and far between. That means you are stuck playing with individuals who have thousands of hours played in SS14 and even more in SS13. You will feel like everybody is rushing around you and getting annoyed by your slow *ss. Don't even dream about playing antagonist or taking part in any combat. You will be knowledge and control gapped most of the time by veterans. Which in itself is part of any multiplayer game. The skill floor here is just higher i guess.

However the problem with admins and regulars on SS14 servers is the clique-like nature. You will be an outcast. You will be a nuisence to them. You will be targeted first. They will "cheat" according to THEIR rules. They will talk on Discord about who is a Syndicate agent. They will scout you while in ghost mode. If they are security they will do anything in their power to stomp anything fun happening. Then they will go on and complain about boring rounds. Genius.

Overall very weird vibes. I don't think it's worth your time investment to learn the game.

otherwise, you need experience for this entry level job

(13 hours because for 11 of those i simply forgot it open)
too political. I just want to enjoy the game without being spoon fed troon propaganda
Has some plus sides but 13 is way ahead in everything. Not much improvement.

I personally believe that this is just the unemployed bitches dream of having a blue collar job because of the current morphine dosage of the United State's job market.

The gameplay loop is forever shadowed by the illusion of choice, just with a different flavor of menial task. This truly is a reflection on capitalism at its finest.

I am glad that I am not touching this game with a two mile long pole after giving it a decent chance, but the fact that I somehow fucked up by sinking more than a full day in this game, makes me want the time I wasted back.

Don't get this game unless you want the exhaustion of a blue collar worker past your day job.

TL:DR; Actually looking for a job is more fun than playing this game, because at least I know there's a chance of a better outcome in the longrun.
Full of furries and troons. Launched the game, first thing I saw was "black lives matter" Cringe!
If you want a worse version of Space Station 13, - then this game is for you!
somehow the various servers on here have communities so much worse than ss13's that its not even funny. dont reccomend
fine enough game but the community is miserable and you have to find gems in the coalmine to really enjoy the game

You will be knowledge and control gapped most of the time by veterans. Which in itself is part of any multiplayer game. The skill floor here is just higher i guess.

However the problem with admins and regulars on SS14 servers is the clique-like nature. You will be an outcast. You will be a nuisence to them. You will be targeted first. They will "cheat" according to THEIR rules. They will talk on Discord about who is a Syndicate agent. They will scout you while in ghost mode. If they are security they will do anything in their power to stomp anything fun happening. Then they will go on and complain about boring rounds. Genius.

Overall very weird vibes. I don't think it's worth your time investment to learn the game.

servers always full or need signup, spent 40 minutes just looking for places that i could actually play, too many attrition points just to open a game and not know what to do, and on the rare times you do get to play then gameplay is yet another hurdle to understand
only servers i was actually allowed in were dead ones

if you have the privilege of playing it, probably awesome
otherwise, you need experience for this entry level job

(13 hours because for 11 of those i simply forgot it open)
too political. I just want to enjoy the game without being spoon fed troon propaganda
Has some plus sides but 13 is way ahead in everything. Not much improvement.

I personally believe that this is just the unemployed bitches dream of having a blue collar job because of the current morphine dosage of the United State's job market.

The gameplay loop is forever shadowed by the illusion of choice, just with a different flavor of menial task. This truly is a reflection on capitalism at its finest.

I am glad that I am not touching this game with a two mile long pole after giving it a decent chance, but the fact that I somehow fucked up by sinking more than a full day in this game, makes me want the time I wasted back.

Don't get this game unless you want the exhaustion of a blue collar worker past your day job.

TL:DR; Actually looking for a job is more fun than playing this game, because at least I know there's a chance of a better outcome in the longrun.
Full of furries and troons. Launched the game, first thing I saw was "black lives matter" Cringe!
If you want a worse version of Space Station 13, - then this game is for you!
somehow the various servers on here have communities so much worse than ss13's that its not even funny. dont reccomend
fine enough game but the community is miserable and you have to find gems in the coalmine to really enjoy the game
